title: Ojibwe language
summary: Ojibwe /oʊˈdʒɪbweɪ/,[2] also known as Ojibwa /oʊˈdʒɪbwə/,[3][4][5] Ojibway, Otchipwe,[6] or Ojibwemowin, is an indigenous language of North America of the Algonquian language family.[7][8] The language is characterized by a series of dialects that have local names and frequently local writing systems. There is no single dialect that is considered the most prestigious or most prominent, and no standard writing system that covers all dialects.
